page.title: 08Map making in Landford
page.content: Landford Manor is used today by a company that makes maps and plans.They make their maps from aerial photographs taken from the company's Piper Seneca aircraft.The special camera takes overlapping pictures of the area to be mapped, and labels them. The pictures are turned into diapositives, which look like negatives but are the right way round. Two of these are put into a drawing machine which shows the operator a 3D view of the area. He traces round allthe features with a pointer and they are drawn onto a piece of plastic which will not stretch or shrink like paper. Information about heights and lines is fed into the computer, and then the maps are printed off. They are mostly large scale maps for new roads, waste disposal sites, or buildings in towns.
